org.orgName: United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.

IN THE MATTER OF the application of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Bail and Supersedeas Bond.

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that we, FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF as principal and Geo W. Hill ----- and Era Bell Hill ------- his wife, and Michael Marion Null, and Nell Johnson his wife, as sureties, are held and firmly bound unto the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, for the use of whomsoever is or shall be entitled thereto, in the penal sum of FIVE HUNDRED DOLLAR ($500.00), to be paid the said obligee; for the payment of which, well and truly to be made, we bind ourselves and each of us, our and each of our heirs, executors, administrators and successors, jointly and severally, firmly by these presents.
Sealed with out seals and dated this 8th day of October, A. D. 1915.

WHEREAS, the above bounden FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF, has prosecuted an appeal to the SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES to reverse the judgement rendered in the above entitled cause by the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, entered in said court on the 30th day of September A.D. 1915, denying the petition of the above named petitioner for a writ of Habeas Corpus and his discharge thereon and remanding him to the custody of the Sheriff of King County, Washington and he desires to supersede and stay the said judgement and order appealed from;

NOW THEREFORE, the condition of this obligation is such, that if the said FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF shall prosecute his said appeal to effect and abide by and perform the judgement which the said Supreme Court may render in said cause, or on the mandate of this court by the court below, and shall be and appeat at all such times and places as this Supreme Court or the said court below may order and direct,
then this obligation to be void; otherwise, of full force and effect.
Francis Stephen Medcraf Michael Marion Null Nell Johnson Null George W. Hill Era Bella Hill
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING SS

BE IT KNOWN that, on this 8th day of October A.D. 1915, before the undersigned, a Notary Public of the State of Washington duly commissioned and sworn, personall came FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF, Michael Marion Null & Nell Johnson Null his wife and Geo W. Hill & Era Bell Hill his wife to me known personally to be the same persons named in and who executed the foregoing BOND and they severally acknowledged the execution thereof to be their free and voluntary act and deed and for the uses and purposes therein free and voluntary act and deed and for the uses and purposes therein expressed.
Witness my hand and official seal the day and year last above written. Geo D. Emery Notary Public for Washington Residing at Seattle.
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING SS

Geo W. Hill & Era Bell Hill his wife AND Michael Marion Null and Nell Johnson Null his wife BEING FIRST DULY SWORN SEVERALLY DOTH SAY: THAT they are the sureties named in the foregoing bond; that they are residents and freeholders of the State of Washington and the communities which they respectively compose are eachworth the sum of ONE THOUSAND ($1,000.00) --- DOLLARS over and above their debts and liabilites and exclusive of their property exempt by law from sale on execution.
Michael Marion Null Nell Johnson Null George W Hill Era Bell Hill
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 8th day of October A.D. 1915. Geo D. Emery Notary Public for Washington Residing at Seattle.
